chargeHist.descr: Illegal Shining of Deer, Elk, or Bear

result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott David Raymond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Scott David Raymond is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Scott David Raymond was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Submit DNA sample and pay surcharges.  *Bond on file to be applied and balance paid within 60 days.  
*All firearms will be returned to the defendant except for the one that was engaged, item #10 in the police report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott David Raymond

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Scott David Raymond in court with attorney Michael Lim.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16FO5, 16FO6 & 16FO7 tracking with:
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 3 in 16CM15 to Disorderly Conduct 947.01(1), Class B Misd.   Atty Hendee states plea agreement to 16FO6 and the amended Ct. 3 in 16CM15.  Counts 1 & 2 in 16CM15 to be dismissed along with 16FO5 & 16FO7.  Atty Hendee stipulates that all firearms will be returned to the defendant except for the one that was engaged.
Atty Lim agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.   Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 3 in 16CM15 to Disorderly Conduct 947.01(1), Class B Misd.  Counts 1 & 2 in 16CM15 to be dismissed along with 16FO5 & 16FO7.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Lim makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  16FO6:  Pay $217.90
16CM15:  Amended Ct. 3:  Pay fine and costs = $442.00
*DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
*2 year Revocation of the defendant's hunting privilages as under chapter 29 statute
All firearms will be returned to the Defendant except for the one that was engaged, item #10 in the police report. 
Counts 1 & 2 in 16CM15, 16FO5 & 16FO7 to be dismissed.
bond to be applied
Return date on May 13, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Attorney Michael Lim in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Lim files an authorization to appear with the court.  Court accepts the authorization and approves it.
  Atty Lim states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Lim enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 11:15 am.
